intro: Centaurea orphanidea, commonly known as the rare centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Centaurea orphanidea is considered a rare and endangered species.
